secText: Intensity is a property measured for both sound and light.
Intensity is the power passing through a unit area. Greater intensity means more power, or more energy per unit time through a given surface area.

The equation shows how intensity varies with distance from a light source that shines equally in all directions. The equation reflects how electromagnetic radiation spreads out from a source radiating with power P, covering a larger sphere over time. The surface area of that sphere is 4πr2, the denominator of the equation.
